page.title: 20Land Coverage Dalgety Bay.
page.content:
Before the construction of private housing a large area of Dalgety Bay was covered in deciduous and evergreen woodland. Over the years this has been cut down to make way for new building sites. However,small areas of woodland have been conserved near the shore. Areas of farmland used for growing grain crops such as barley,oats and wheat and as pasture for sheep have been reduced to make way for housing and roads. Farming land and deciduous and evergreen woodland still remain toward Braefoot Point but even some of this land has been cleared for the building of Shell/Esso liquid gas terminal.
Karen Hudspeth. Neil Jamieson.
Gordon Macfarlane. Thomas McNamara.
